intro: Psammagrostis wiseana, commonly known as the desertgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. This plant is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to conserve water. It produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typical of grasses. Psammagrostis wiseana is well-suited to sandy soils and can thrive in harsh, dry environments.
